title: Ticket #3769: "condor_chirp is not a command-line tool." Yes it is.
description:
/doc/man-pages/condor_chirp.tex opens with 

\Condor{chirp} is not a command-line tool.

How is it not a command line tool? It's an executable with no GUI, which is how I would define a command line tool. I suspect the intent is to clarify that it's not intended for interactive use (although it might be useful under condor_ssh_to_job!). It's intended to be used by jobs instead. It might be good to rephrase, since the current phrasing seems confusing.
check_ins: 2013-Jul-29 10:33   Check-in [37029]: modify misleading opening sentence that says that condor_chirp is NOT a command-line tool. ===GT=== #3769 (By Karen Miller )
creator: adesmet
